Far too many communities across the Southwest Side experience major flooding issues with storms. 

I visited La Grange to talk about new projects we can create with the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that will help alleviate flooding and fix our stormwater sewer system. https://t.co/eMFx3wNsgh

Hey @GovAbbott, I am a proud parent of a trans daughter. 

Your political ploy to terrorize children and their parents is sickening.

Trans children are not political props.

Shame on you. Resign. https://t.co/NrTKk8fwxD

Here are just a few reasons why we need to get rid of the filibuster.

👉The Equality Act
👉 The PRO Act
👉 Universal background checks
👉 For the People Act
👉 DC Statehood
👉 $15 minimum wage 
👉 Women’s Health Protection Act

The choice is simple.

THIS is the future of public transit 👇
🚌 Accessible
💳 Affordable
🌎 Sustainable

All made possible by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law 💪 
https://t.co/YJwnR4sgfK

Our office is in every corner of the Southwest Side and suburbs bringing our constituent services to YOU.

Register below to join our mobile sites this week! 👇https://t.co/yqbRDRH3HH https://t.co/o3GIpJUjoz

A law proposed in Indiana would ELIMINATE the need to obtain a permit to carry a handgun.

While gun laws stop at state lines — guns do not.

This will make it easier for bad actors in Illinois and Indiana to have access to guns. This bill must be stopped.
https://t.co/8GahPBZUw3

Child poverty has risen by 40% since the Child Tax Credit expired.

That is 3.7 MILLION kids.

50 Republicans and one corporate Democrat are putting politics ahead of hungry children. 

Enough with the obstruction, we MUST make this tax credit permanent.
Happy President’s Day, especially to these two fellow Illinoisans! https://t.co/cSeJsI5nJk

🚨 Our southwest suburban health fair is FRIDAY! 

Register below to stop by for FREE health care services ⬇️ https://t.co/yqbRDRH3HH https://t.co/ZmYDZUAdAI

Service workers have kept our economy running over the past two years. 

Ensuring they have fair wages and just working conditions is the least we can do to support them. https://t.co/jmJq8oPZ2b

✅ Co-signed a letter to @USDOT urging the prioritization of equity, safety, and climate resilience in infrastructure projects. 

Hope everyone enjoys the long weekend!

✅ Joined @dupageforest for a tour of Waterfall Glen to discuss the importance of investing in our local natural spaces.  

✅ Co-sponsored a resolution in honor of the victims of the 2019 shooting in Aurora, IL.

✅ Announced a $1 BILLION investment in the Great Lakes that will sustain our Midwest ecosystem and economy. 

✅ Cheered on the SW Side’s own @KendallCoyne as she competed in Beijing as the @TeamUSA Women‘s Hockey captain.

✅ Visited my alma mater, @SandburgHS, to discuss all they’ve done to support their students through the pandemic. Thank you for the warm welcome! 

✅ Announced $7.8 MILLION in funding for @Argonne from @ENERGY for clean energy projects that will create new, good-paying jobs.

✅ Delivered dozens of handmade valentines to veterans and healthcare workers across the Southwest Side and suburbs. I was honored to thank them for their service and spread some Valentine's Day joy across the district.

Let’s take look back at the work we’ve done this week 👇

✅ Announced a health clinic next week in Bridgeview to bring free, accessible health care services to the Southwest suburbs. Sign up HERE ⬇️ https://t.co/yqbRDRH3HH https://t.co/XSo8Iv7Lq8

In the wealthiest country in the world, Americans should not be dying because Big Pharma is skyrocketing the cost of lifesaving insulin.

We need to pass the Build Back Better Act to cap insulin costs for American families at $35. https://t.co/QQGTuRKfqY
Shameful and infuriating that 50 senators couldn’t agree to continue a program that has proven to cut child hunger and poverty. https://t.co/w3s4MCdiaQ

Really? Last year was the deadliest on record for transgender Americans. You just passed a discriminatory bill that attacks trans kids who just want be themselves and play sports.

Want to figure out why LGBTQ+ youth are more prone to depression? It’s because of people like you. https://t.co/it9qaLxIfe

🚨BREAKING: Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw, $1 BILLION is being invested to protect the health of our Great Lakes.

From cleaning up our shoreline to restoring Lake Michigan's ecosystem, these funds will protect the economic and environmental anchor of the Midwest.

I’m incredibly proud of our Southwest Side’s very own @KendallCoyne who led @TeamUSA as captain in one helluva championship game against Canada last night.

While it was a tough loss, I know that USA Women’s Hockey will be back on the ice in no time.

📸@GettySport @TeamUSA https://t.co/uSMADzG4FL
@Rnolting21 Thank you for having me-- was great to visit today! Go Eagles!

It was GREAT to be back at my alma mater, @SandburgHS in Orland Park. We discussed student mental health, school labor shortages and more! 

I am so impressed with all of the young people on our Southwest Side who are committed to serving their community. Thanks for having me! https://t.co/fhHJskUsOP

Democrats have a plan to lower costs for working families on everything from prescription drugs to childcare. 

It’s time to pass Build Back Better and get this done.

Want to learn more about how legislation is passed on Capitol Hill or the casework performed by a Congressional office? 

Apply to be a summer intern with my team— our internships pay $15 an hour! 

Application information HERE: https://t.co/gzUTpY8HTK https://t.co/dP4WpWSFfV

I'm glad to see gun manufacturers finally being held accountable for profiting off of violence and tragedy. 

I will keep standing up to the gun lobby and advocating for common-sense gun safety to keep our kids and communities safe. Thanks for leading this fight @shannonrwatts 💪 https://t.co/EGVCMUonxS

I joined @DuPageForest for a tour of our very own Waterfall Glen!

I’m fighting to ensure we make real investments in our local forest preserves so that we can protect our green space and all of the animals that live there. https://t.co/dPuZiUWiEU
RT if you agree it’s time to get Louis DeJoy out of the U.S. Postal Service.

My constituents are waiting MONTHS to get their prescription medicine, bills and more.

House Democrats and Republicans passed this bill last week. Enough with childish gimmicks. Let’s fix USPS’ finances, support our postal workers, and finally deliver the damn mail on time. https://t.co/pxOw9tQthw

🚨HUGE NEWS: Our very own @Argonne has received $7.8 MILLION in funding from @ENERGY for clean energy projects that will create new good-paying jobs.

Last year, I welcomed @GinaMcCarthy46 at the lab to show her how we are leading America's response to this global climate crisis. https://t.co/TfPoUTxNMX

Today, my staff and I delivered dozens of handmade valentines to veterans and healthcare workers across the Southwest Side and suburbs. 

I was honored to have the opportunity to thank them for their service and spread some Valentine's Day joy across the district 🎉💌 https://t.co/lAjNON0ZsV

Four years ago, we lost 17 precious lives at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida. 

They were students, staff, sons, daughters and loved ones to so many. 

Congress has an obligation to honor their lives by passing real, common-sense gun reform NOW. https://t.co/jFsgP50kLi
Iggy has been training hard for the puppy bowl tonight 💪🐶🏈 https://t.co/ZTPiSPLX0N

🚨ICYMI: my team is hosting a health clinic later this month to bring free, accessible health services to the Southwest Side. 

Register HERE: https://t.co/yqbRDRH3HH https://t.co/3RkDQeaQ5u

✅ Joined my congressional colleagues in a moment of silence to honor the 900,000 American souls lost to COVID. 

We’ll be back in Illinois next week 💪

✅ Co-signed a letter to the FDA urging them to immediately end the discriminatory ban on gay and bisexual men donating blood.  

✅ Co-signed a letter to @POTUS urging action to combat methane emissions.

✅ Collected handmade valentines from across our district to deliver to local veterans on Valentine’s Day. 

✅ Co-signed a letter to the DOJ urging them to take action against insider election security threats.

✅ Welcomed representatives from @mortoncollege and @morainevalley to DC to discuss the importance of supporting our local community colleges. 

✅ Co-sponsored @RepAndyLevin’s resolution in support of Congressional Staff having the right to unionize.

✅ Announced $921 million in grant funding to keep thousands of CTA workers on the job. 

✅ Voted to PASS groundbreaking legislation to end forced arbitration for sexual assault and harassment.

We’ve had a busy week in DC! Here’s some of what we’ve done 👇

✅ Voted to PASS the Postal Service Reform Act to fix USPS’s financing and end postal delays across the Southwest Side and suburbs. https://t.co/oUk6ndjs1r

I’m leading a letter to the State Department to demand they address the humanitarian crisis in the Rukban settlement in Syria.

Tens of thousands of Syrians remain without access to health care, clean water, food or COVID vaccines and tests. We must step in to help NOW. https://t.co/Cr9jvJXS9T

Thank you to the students across the district who submitted such thoughtful valentines for our local veterans.

Today is the last day to drop your valentines off at our Chicago office or submit them online HERE: https://t.co/zsVHmNnKNQ https://t.co/jipLTAXyOL

Big Pharma knows they’re scamming the American people — that’s why they pay millions to lobby Congress. 

It’s time to put the American people before special interests and lower prescription drug prices NOW.

A Jan 6 defendant, who was ordered by a judge to not be in possession of any firearms, was able to buy 𝟯𝟰 GUNS due to a loophole in the background check system.

I’m joining @RepMaloney in introducing the #PreventingPretrialGunPurchases Act to close this dangerous loophole.

We had some furry friends 🐶🐕 sit in on our legislative meeting this week! 

Thanks for joining, Tank and Finley! https://t.co/jnJQwD92YZ

Thank you to @cmapillinois for joining me to discuss the implementation of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law in the Southwest Side and suburbs.

Grateful to have you as a partner as we fight for accessible, more efficient, and greener transit across the district 💪 https://t.co/IkUK1m9XWN

I’m fighting to make health care accessible and affordable to folks across the Southwest Side and suburbs. 

That’s why I am thrilled to be hosting a health clinic in Bridgeview in two weeks! Sign up HERE to join me: https://t.co/yqbRDRH3HH https://t.co/bF9zetKWn3

We are seeing an alarming trend of state-sanctioned hate and violence against the LGBTQI+ community around the world. 

Today I voted to pass the #GlobalRespectAct to ensure that our fight for justice and LGBTQI+ equality does not stop at our borders.

Investing in our community colleges and strengthening pathways to higher education will better connect our next generation to the good-paying jobs of the future.

I welcomed @mortoncollege and @morainevalley to my D.C. office today to discuss how Congress can do just that. https://t.co/JwOHa9hQCn

In 1974, Mary Wallace became the first female bus driver for @cta. 

This #BlackHistoryMonth, I am proud to celebrate this pioneer who broke barriers in Chicago’s transit industry. https://t.co/TYigOvponj

Postal delays are persistent across the Southwest Side and suburbs.

Today I voted YES to pass legislation that will help change that.

The bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct will tackle postal delays and ensure the @USPS can continue its vital work for years to come.

During #SaferInternetDay, we must be clear-eyed about what social media companies are teaching our children.

I'm joining @RepSusanWild in calling on @YouTube to remove "How To Tie a Noose" videos, which could be the difference between life and death for kids considering suicide. https://t.co/yjMvZGkN2O

🚨BIG NEWS: Our office has helped secure $912 MILLION in grant funding for the @CTA!

These funds will keep our transit workers on the payroll and ensure our trains and buses continue to help Chicagoans get to where they need to go 🚆

Last night, I joined my colleagues on the steps of the US Capitol to honor the more than 900,000 souls our nation has lost to COVID. 

My prayers go out to all of their loved ones as we continue to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/36f7X5nMyY

💼Employment
🏡Nursing homes

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law provides billions to invest in our water infrastructure and create jobs.

But we must also strengthen the laws that protect our water resources. That’s why I joined 120 @HouseDemocrats calling for the swift repeal of Trump’s #DirtyWaterRule.

Workers across the country want to organize, but they often face aggressive anti-union scare tactics once they do. 

Let’s pass the PRO Act in the Senate and give EVERYONE the freedom to organize a union. https://t.co/Wwn85JKJ7W

✅ Co-signed a letter to House and Senate leadership urging them to take immediate action to lower prescription drug prices

I voted to pass the America COMPETES Act because it's time we strengthen local manufacturing, fix our supply chains and invest in our workers.

This legislation will ensure America continues to lead the rest of the world in innovation and economic strength. https://t.co/pNJLwftnkL

Far too often, transit investments go to the communities that already have the most resources, not to those who need it most.

This #TransitEquityDay, let's commit to making transit accessible to EVERYONE.

🚨My two amendments to the America COMPETES Act have PASSED the House.

They target economic investment towards two groups frequently left behind: 
👷Workers &
⚙️Small Manufacturers

This is a victory for an economy that works for EVERYONE, not just those at the top.

Today, I encourage all members of the public to take a moment of silence to remember the courage, bravery and sacrifice those officers and many others demonstrated during that tragic day.

Our first responders make sacrifices every day to keep our communities safe.

It's on us to not only express our gratitude but ensure we enact legislation to make their jobs as safe as possible. Let's get this done.

The adoption of fire sprinklers in the last 40 years has led to an almost 50% reduction in fire deaths in the US.

Yet, we continue to see far too many firefighter and resident deaths that are caused by fires spreading in older high-rise buildings due to a lack of sprinklers.

The current tax code treats fire sprinklers the same as plumbing and their costs are depreciated over 39 years.

Our High-Rise Fire Sprinkler Incentive Act simply decreases this cost recovery to 15 years, incentivizing building owners to install fire sprinklers.

🚨BIG NEWS: I joined @BillPascrell & @RepJohnKatko today in introducing bipartisan legislation to protect our firefighters.

This bill amends the tax code to create a new incentive for owners to install sprinklers in residential buildings that were erected before fire codes.🧵👇
